author: lebu
title: Just What You Wanted To Get
body:
Inside the compound, she could see the car of her sister, Ono, where it was parked in its usual place..Ono, the first of her parents five children and a mother of three, was eleven years older than Jite and  married to Fidelis Jang who was from Jos in Plateau state.



 An architect,  Fidelis was even seven years older than Ono and worked in an international company. Ono who'd been attending a church but not a committed Christian, had been in a relationship with a man who was her classmate in High school but when she met Fidelis, she dumped the man and church, and married Fidelis who was not a believer. 



Now, Fidelis had finished building their house and the family would be moving in soon. In between Ono and Jite were two brothers, John and Austin, and a sister, Maria,  all of whom were married. The two brothers and Maria were Christians.


 Jite attended the University in Asaba,  her hometown in Delta state and lived with her parents because their rented apartment was not far from the University.
root_title: Just What You Wanted To Get

author: lebu
title: The Search for the right one; Episode 19
body:
She looked out of her side window. He unplugged the phone from the car charger, tapped it, and began to talk. "How are you -- I'm driving-- I'll call you later - okay - bye." He put the phone in his pocket but almost immediately, it began to ring again. This time, the ringtone was the laughter of a child.




Jite thought that the first call must have been from a woman, probably his girlfriend. If he had a girlfriend,  why then was he trying to date her? She smiles and took a deep breath. Well, she would put him in his place. Soon, they reached her Street and she told him to stop in front of a three storey building. Four woman stood by a car, talking. 




"Thanks a lot." She said. "Good night." "Good night." She got down, closed the door and waved at him. He waved back and left. She looked at the woman talking; one of them tenant in the house. Jite greeted the elderly woman before walking past to open the pedestrian gate of the house.

author: lebu
title: The Search for the right one; Episode 18
body:
She shook her head. "No, I won't do that. That's double dating." "That's being smart." He told her. "No, I don't do that. It's cheating and it's not fair. How would you feel if you got to know that the lady you wanted to marry was seeing another man?"



"I wouldn't like it but that's not the issue here." He said, dismissing her argument. She turned to him and as she asked "what's the issue?" She considered him. She guessed he would be in his early thirties. He wasn't really what you would call handsome but he was charming and spoke very good English which she liked.



"The issue is that I really like you." He declared. She shook her head. "What exactly is the problem?" He asked and glanced at her. "Is it a sin to like a lady?" Before she could respond, lady started playing on his cell phone which jite knew was Lionel Richie's song.

title: The Search for the right one; Episode 2
body:
In the evening of that same Thursday, in Abuja, Nigeria, a special programme for singles tagged 'issue of dating' was going on at Chapel of christ the lord, the church where twenty six year old Onajite Edewor worshipped. As the day was holiday and people did not go to work, the large hall was almost full.



As the female guest minister standing on the altar talked about relationship matters, Onajite listened, her eyes following the woman's every movement. Jite, as everyone called her, was curvaceous, dark in complexion, and five feet five inches tall.




Being an usher, she was standing at the back of the hall by the main entrance. Two female ushers were with her, one on her left and the other on her right. The three of them had some copies of the programme in their hands. The guest minister who jite guessed would be in her forties went on.

Jonathan: No, I haven’ I haven’t been there since I came to live in America but I hope to visit very soon. My parents and family members are there, I also have friends there as well but What I do is try as much as possible to participate in some Nigerian events here.

author: lebu
title: I can't wait to see her. An open letter to my love.
body:
Today makes it a year I have sighted my love. I just hope she would understand my feeling for her. It  just a matter of a month, then I will be fully yours forever by then. You will be able to see me whenever you hope to see me then. 



  ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/mr26o1h3r0.jpg)



And i promise to take from that house you complain bitterly about. My love just be patient enough for me,  through this period of one month remaining. I am working towards all my promise made to you, and I think you will  be happy to  see the hopes and aspiration you want when am back.





 I could feel the love, romance and emotional trauma you are going through every day but all my promise to you will be fully fulfill and hopefully you will forget some night you had miss my warmeth  touch, kiss, and the affectionate. This is an open letter to my love.
root_title: I can't wait to see her. An open letter to my love.

author: lebu
title: Life's goes on
body:
People tends to forget how they find their way to that elevator point. But I want to quickly remind you when you are nobody and you have nothing to write about your history.


 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/dwj1pob9qv.jpg)



 Just because you are chance doesn't mean you should behave to your benefactor anyhow. I can possibly tell you that the yoruba always say if you have your way through in life, there are some people who have contributed to the point you are today. 


But the life we live on now make it difficult for you to think about helping one out. So what do think of those who have the minds to render assistance to people. This is why they choose not to do it because after sharping the teeth of the people looking for assistance, they tend to bite the benefactor after being good to them.


 I just believed that life goes on, no matter what the situation we find ourselves.
root_title: Life's goes on

author: lebu
title: Get it done in the right way.
body:
I quite understand to make it in life is quite difficult, but there is this side force of achievement which pushed human being backward and forward of their glory. It only takes people who are dedicated and committed to attain success in life are the one who move or advanced forward to the elevated point. 


 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/ctgasl6tze.jpg)


So to make it in life you have extra work to do with your acceleration and way you can comprehend with the situation around you. If you're the type that is slow learner, you don't have much time to waste like other who can grab fast when it comes to digestion of information.




 But because you are slow does not mean that you cannot achieve also. Indeed  my advice to you is to get what you're doing right from the onset for yourself. At the end you have something to act on doing and you will be proud to tell the story that you are on the right side.
root_title: Get it done in the right way.

author: lebu
title: The Search for the right one; Episode 21
body:
Ono was cooking in kitchen while her children were in the living room watching Tom and Jerry cartoon on the flat screen TV. Amos, the second child had a big toy car in his hands. The sofa and armchair were made of beige leather. The dining area was in a corner. six chair surrounded the table with an oak finished top.



The three children looked up at Jite. Eight year old Jonah who looked a lot like his father was in class four in one of the private Elementary schools In the neighborhood. He was intellectually quick, outspoken, and assertive. As a baby, he was very cute and everyone wanted to carry him. As he grew, he became very active and would scream if he didn't get what he wanted or wanted a particular person to him.

author: lebu
title: The Search for the right one; Episode 20
body:
After her graduation and the completion of the one year mandatory service by nigeria graduates five years ago, Jite decided to move to Abuja, to live with Ono's family. She wanted to get a job and also assist Ono in taking care of her three children: Jonah, Amos, and the youngest and only female, Mary.



Jite climbed the stairs and soon reached the first floor. She turned right toward the door of the three bedroom apartment at the back. Bringing out a bunch of keys, she selected one and unlocked the door. As she stepped inside the living room, she was greeted by the aroma of boiled chicken and voice from TV.
root_title: The Search for the right one; Episode 20
